message: "Starting in Python 3.3, any modules added to the standard library must have a pure Python implementation." http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0399/
And stay tuned for my presentation for a top-secret case where pypy is still slower than cpython! :)
Watch the realtime image processing demo later - it's crazy awesome. http://morepypy.blogspot.com/2011/07/realtime-image-processing-in-python.html
What's the reason pypy can't be made to just link with standard C modules, anyway?  Pretty sure this is the main reason pypy isn't used in some pretty large codebases with custom C modules.
